overview:
Hugo is a lecturer, researcher, software architect and developer with over 10 years experience focused in high-quality, highly-adaptable, large-scale and critical solutions. His career experience encompases projects for government, military and businesses, both at national and international level. Today Hugo specialises in research, training and consultancy in Object-Oriented Programming, Software Architecture, Agile Methodologies, UML and Design Patterns.

After receiving a Licentiate Engineering degree in Informatics and Computation Engineering, Hugo worked in military R&D for NATO at ParadigmaXis, S.A. There he progressively assumed the roles of developer, team leader, software architect, and project manager in several government and privately held projects. Once a PhD candidate in meta-programming and model-driven software engineering, Hugo has been lecturing at various universities for a number of years, principally at the Faculty of Engineering of the University of Porto. He has since been awarded his Joint PhD, with distinction, in Computer Science by the Universities of Minho (UM), Aveiro (UA) and Porto (UP).
